title: Modeling the problem
text: For any length of ladder, the base needs to be a distance from the wall equal to one forth of the ladder's length. Equivalently, if the base of the ladder is 'a' feet from the wall, the length of the ladder will be 4a feet.\n##figure1.gif##

title: Cosine Function
text: We can use the cosine function to find this angle. To do this, we should divide the length of the side adjacent to θ by the hypotenuse.

title: Cosine Function
text: The side adjacent to θ is a and the hypotenuse is 4a.

title: Solving cosine function
text: We therefore should solve $$cos\theta=\frac{a}{4} a$$. This is the same as $$tan\theta=\frac{1}{4}$$.

title: Solving for θ
text: To solve for theta, type $${cos}^{-1\left(\frac{1}{4}\right)}$$ into your calculator. Make sure it is in degree mode.

title: Solving for θ
text: What do you get for θ after solving this? Round to the nearest decimal point.
